page.title: 09CHIPPING WARDEN CHURCH
page.content: SS Peter and Paul Church stands in the S.W. part of the village. It is part of the Peterborough Diocese. The church is built in a variety of styles (Decorated Perpendicular and even some traces of Norman) Major construction was during the 14th and 15th centuries.Local stone Marlstone, has been used.The church consists of a clerestoried nave of six bays and supported by lofty arcades, a chancel, north and south aisles, a south porch, a chantry chapel and vestry and a square tower at the west end.The organ is late 19th century, restored in 1977. The tower contains 5 bells, cast in Chacombe and hung in 1674. The clock dates back to 1768. The first recorded date of a rector is 1243. There have been 4 rectors since the Second World War. Mr Robertson-Glas gow was here nearly 30 years.
